Learning from those who came before us is instrumental to success, but we often forget an important caveat. Almost all advice is contextual, yet it is rarely delivered with any context. “You just need to charge more!” says the company […]

docs.title: RFC processes are a poor fit for most organizations – Jacob Kaplan-Moss
docs.text: RFC processes are a poor fit for most organizations - Jacob Kaplan-Moss –The RFC process has been a huge success in defining the standards that run the Internet, but naively adopting this process for your company is a mistake. RFC processes tend to fail at most organizations because they lack a clear decision-making step.
